White Mountains off the Beaten Path:

Speckled Mountain, Ames Mountain & Blueberry Mountain Traverse
Caribou-Speckled Mountain Wilderness off Evans Notch

New Hampshire is home to most of the White Mountain National Forest, but 49,166 of its acres cross into Maine. Within this expanse lies Caribou-Speckled Mountain Wilderness. Encompassing both Caribou Mountain and Speckled Mountain, it is the state's newest and largest wilderness, an area of steep terrain along a jumbled mass of ridges opened by numerous ledges and forested with northern hardwoods. This hike traverses Speckled Mountain, Ames Mountain and Blueberry Mountain. In addition there are numerous views from the Blueberry Ridge Trail.

Mileage 7.36 mi
Book Time: 5 hr 53 min

Trails Used:
starting at Spruce Hill Trail, Evans Notch
Bickford Brook Trail, Blueberry Ridge Trail, Lookout Loop and Bickford Brook Trail
ending at Brickett Place, Evans Notch

Please refer to AMC's Main Mountain Guide for more detailed information.

Gear: traction (Micro-Spikes) and cold weather clothing are required for this hike.

Note: if we make good time, there will be an opportunity to do another short hike while in Evans Notch.
